author: potuz
content: Oh nvm, they've already been banned and the messages weren't deleted.

author: chfast
content:
<@403707149043105803> I think we missed something in context of EOF and 31-byte chunking. The 1 byte prefix is only needed to runtime check the jump target. This is not needed in EOF. We will know where to start executing a chunk based on the previous instruction.

I.e. EOF can pack code into 32-byte chunks. ðŸŽ‰ ðŸ¥³

author: axic3354
content: Yup, we discussed this at Edelweiss ðŸ™‚

author: axic3354
content: The only improvement we could make is interleaving code/type headers to reduce the number of header chunks in case of subset of functions are needed.

author: gumb00
content: My takeaway from today is that we could also go over what header values are required at runtime for what opcodes and consider verkle-optimizing the format for to make them more local

author: gumb00
content:
example is CALLF currently requires at time:
- offset to start target execution
- target's max_stack_height
- target's number of inputs

- offset potentially could be put into CALLF's immediate instead of target index
- max_stack_height and inputs potentially could be put in front of target section code instead of header
